title.rendered: Anand Mahindra ‘grateful to be Mahi-ndra’ after MS Dhoni’s 6-spree at Wankhede

content.rendered:
After MS Dhoni’s hard work against MI at Wankhede, Anand Mahindra declared that “unnecessary pressure and expectations” were adding “fuel” to Dhoni’s “fire”.

After MS Dhoni took his sixth hat-trick at Mumbai’s Wankhede Stadium and led Chennai Super Kings (CSK) to victory against Mumbai Indians (MI). Anand Mahindra shared a post praising the cricketer. He expressed his admiration for Dhoni’s ability to perform well under pressure and high expectations. Mahindra further said that it is proud to have ‘Mahi’ in its name. Mahindra shared a message from user X Johns. who called Dhoni “the greatest finisher of all time”. This is when Dhoni made 20 runs off Hardik Pandya in the 20th over, leading his team to a score of 206 for four.

Mahindra also expressed his interest in Dhoni, saying: “Show me a player who does better than this guy – with unnecessary expectations and pressure.

As expected, Mahindra’s post went viral on social media with over 1.3 million likes. Many people have taken to the comment section of the post to share their thoughts.

He further expressed that he is “grateful” to have “Mahi” in his name. “Today, I’m simply grateful that my name is Mahi-ndra….”

Mahindra’s post, as expected, went viral on social media with over 1.3 million views. Many even flocked to the comments section of the post to share their thoughts.

Read Also: ‘People are disappointed because Gautam Gambhir hugged me’: Virat Kohli opens up on lack of ‘masala’.
